alert.note: Alert for Platte (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 03 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Missouri, including the following county, Platte. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 829 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms across portions of Platte County. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kansas City, Smithville, Platte City, Edgerton, Dearborn, Camden Point, Ferrelview, Tracy, Farley, Ridgely, Hoover, Kansas City Intl Arpt, Beverly and East Leavenworth. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
